intro: Adicea virgata, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically silver or gray in color, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. Adicea virgata is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
